detailsOfAchievement: The School of Social Work is an NGO running with self supportive mission for the downtroddens. Not only to guide, but also to uplift them in all round development, i.e. Social, economy, literature, health etc; including skill upgradation, especially for women and female-child. It is happy to mention that the society has taken up Ujjawala scheme through the Ministry of Women & Child and is tremendously progressing. The Society also runs a Condensed Course of Education for Women through the Central Social Welfare Board, New Delhi. Shelter-home for women has been set up at 2(two) separate places where Vocational training is imparted. Vocational training for women in plastic, bamboo, cane works etc is provided. Over the past years, the Society had provided livestocks at free cost in 6(six) rural villages achieving a good result of 25(twenty-five) more beneficiaries. These are the highlights of the major activities the Society has accomplished.

detailsOfAchievement: The Organisation has been involved in social services pertaining to upliftment of women and youth, especially, the marginalised sections of the society. We have also been targetting the youth group by giving them career counselling and other such activities. It has been our priority to uplift the womenfolk especially in the rural areas of Tuensang and Mon, where we have been actively engaged in various activities by working together with the Eastern Nagaland Women Organisation (ENWO), which has also been playing proactive role in resolving conflict issues during tribal clashes in the remote areas of Eastern Nagaland. We also extend our contribution to the poor and needy villagers as and when required. Also, identify some poor students and help them financially and morally in their studies. The organisation is also currently working as a consultant NGO for North East Rural Livelihood Project(NERLP), funded by the World Bank. which has been to the poorest of the poor in the remotest parts of Nagaland. Through this Project, we have seen enormous changes amongst the SSG members formed under the aforementioned project. The organisation continues to work hand in hand with other active NGOs like the Eastern Nagaland Women Organisation (ENWO), and others who are committed to bring transformational changes through socio economic development and education.

Backward and forward linkages

The Society of Aborigines, since 2008 has been running an orphanage, Mount Carmel Children’s Home at Sukhalu Village, Zunheboto. The society provides free food, free lodging and free education to children in need of care and protection affected by ethnic violence and other children without parents . Most of the beneficiaries are below 12 years of age and from Neighbouring villages. As a recognition for its activities, the society has been provided with GIA from ICDS Nagaland from 2012.

The society of Aborigines has been maintaining an orphanage Mount Carmel Home comprising of 50 children from families who have lost either of their parents in ethnic violence engulfing the state for the last many years. Due to its past achievements, it is now a recognised and licensed Child Care Institute in the District of Zunheboto. State Child Protection Society, Govt. Of Nagaland has been aiding the Society by providing Grant-In-Aid since 2012.

detailsOfAchievement: Tsughashe Welfare Society is a non-governmental organization registered in 2001 under registration of societies act which has been actively involved in social welfare and rural development programmes.The society has been carrying out and implementing small income generation activities and welfare programmes in rural areas and has successfully helped in enhancing the income of low income generation families and enhancing the skills of the unemployed youths through vocational training and skill development programmes. The society has broadened and expanded its area of objectives to empowerment of women and youth, education, art and craft,healthcare upliftment of the girl child, entreupreneurship programmes, agriculture and animal farming and community development in various aspects. The Society operates with the belief in a holistic vision and collaborative effort with the willingness and active participation of the beneficiaries in the development process to achieve its goals.
